paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant N588K, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The fibroblasts for iPS cell generation were from a 29-year-old male patient with familial SQTS1 carrying a missense mutation (C to G substitution at nucleotide 1764).

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation in KCNH2 is associated with a gain-of-function leading to Short QT Syndrome.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation is present in a familial context, indicating potential segregation with disease.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation impairs inactivation of the KCNH2 channel.
key_quotes: This mutation results in substitution of an amino acid at the position of 588 from asparagine to lysine (N588K) in the KCNH2 (also called HERG or IKr) channel.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant N588K was successfully extracted.
